item.title: alsa-utils' arecord bug: lots of *.wav files, ignoring --duration parameter
item.description: While working on a small side project at work, I found that I can’t record sound using Raspberry Pi with external USB sound card after upgrading it to Raspbian Jessie. Symptoms look rather weird: arecord doesn’t stop recording after a period of time specified by --duration flag, but keeps running and writing garbage to files like *-01.wav, *-02.wav and so on. Google doesn’t really give any solution to this (except the recommendation of terminating arecord using killall -KILL arecord after certain period of time).

item.title: Calibration of MAX31855 thermocouple converter
item.description: I have recently spent some time playing with Maxim 31855 chips, in a need of precise and cheap K-type thermocouple logger. It is a cheap voltage amplifier with digital SPI interface, so it works perfectly well with Raspberry Pi or Arduino. There are many thermocouple amplifiers out there, and I am sure that most of them are properly calibrated for the temperature range around +/-50C, since even linear volt-to-degreeC conversion works fine in that range.

item.title: Amazon Fire TV 2nd Gen - Root & OpenVPN
item.description: My notes after spending half a day playing with my Fire TV. While Amazon Fire TV seems to be the best htpc solution to me, it still requires rooting and a bit of patching on its way to a decent media center. I’m also used to US streaming services (Pandora, Netflix, Hulu, etc) which are only available through VPN, if you are outside of US. Rooting and setting up Kodi + OpenVPN is a way to go.
